5.Summary: "Great job with a great franchise company"
5.Pros: Great incentives around the holidays, dedicated to it's employees and promoting growth.
5.Cons: A lot of pressure put on it's managers with difficult to achieve expectations and select stores have very poor general management resulting in low employee morale.

6.Pros: Decent paying job... not too hard to work
6.Cons: Really greasy and the food get gross after awhile to eat.

7.Pros: -Relatively flexible so long as you let them know in advance-Had security so it felt safe-Good workplace standards and kept clean usually-Overall easygoing coworkers who would help for the most part-50% employee discount
7.Cons: -3 hour training video that taught nothing-If your crew trainer doesn't care you'll be thrown into the flames with no understanding-Consistent state of panic since almost everyone's new yet they expect you to understand the job from day 1-Understaffed and overworked-Breaks would be cut short if they were going down with threats of a write up-Don't expect a pay raise or better position, I trained crew after 4 months of working and still got nothing from it, it's expected.

8.Pros: Good people. Not too challenging. Can be laid back depending on hours
8.Cons: Can be difficult to work with customers. Environment is not the best.

9.Pros: No hospitality, not clean , people are disreptful, no flexible hours
